column1: PaperID,DLC,Email,Title1,Journal-name,Volume,Issue,Issn,Doi,Year Published,First Name,Last Name,MIT ID,Citation,Publisher-name,C-Method-Of-Acquisition,Guidance,C-Publisher-Related-Email-Message,Library Status Last Requested When,Data Source (Publication),Data Source Proprietary ID (Publication)

184490,"Earth, Atmospheric, and Planetary Sciences",fake@EXAMPLE.COM,,Journal of Accounting and Economics,,,,,20090101,Mozaffar,Khan,1425014914,"Estimation and Empirical properties of a Firm-Year Measure of Accounting Conservatism, with Ross Watts, Journal of Accounting and Economics, Dec. 2009.",Elsevier,RECRUIT_FROM_AUTHOR_MANUSCRIPT,"

Regular Elsevier articles

  • We are now (9-1-15) depositing Elsevier manuscripts (AFM) after embargo periods as noted here:
column3:
• Embargoes are calculated from the issue publication date, not the article online publication date. (from Alicia Wise, 8/24/15)
  • After the embargoes, deposit AFM under Publisher Policy with Creative Commons license. Use CC-BY-NC-ND (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/)
  • Info on recent changes: May 2015: Elsevier changed its article-sharing policies
column5: no longer explicitly targets institutions with open access policies.&nbsp
column7: We are making it clear that we want to work with hosting platforms, such as institutional repositories, to make sharing easy and seamless for researchers. We will no longer require an agreement with institutional repositories and instead clarify that self-archived accepted manuscripts can be used under a CC-BY-NC-ND license and that they can be hosted and shared privately during the embargo and publically shared after embargo."
column8:
• As of April 2015, we can no longer take Elsevier Open Archive articles.
  • Previous workflow: Hold all AFM of Elsevier papers published since June 30, 2010 until further notice, including those that are NIH funded and may be on PubMed Central. Place them on the R:drive in the "
column10: folder. If an author (or liaison) has submitted the paper, keep it in the DSpace queue until further notice. Mark papers as received in Access and in the notes field write, &quot
column12:

column425: We are making it clear that we want to work with hosting platforms, such as institutional repositories, to make sharing easy and seamless for researchers.
